drug.name: Zinc picolinate
drug.description: Zinc picolinate is a zinc salt of picolinic acid. It is available as OTC dietary supplements as a source of zinc to treat and prevent zinc deficiency. The absorption of zinc after oral administration of zinc picolinate is shown to be effective.

article.citation: Barrie SA, Wright JV, Pizzorno JE, Kutter E, Barron PC: Comparative absorption of zinc picolinate, zinc citrate and zinc gluconate in humans. Agents Actions. 1987 Jun;21(1-2):223-8.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as pyridinecarboxylic acids. These are compounds containing a pyridine ring bearing a carboxylic acid group.

mixture.name: Tozal
mixture.ingredients: Ascorbic acid + Cholecalciferol + Copper + Cyanocobalamin + Folic acid + Lutein + Omega-3 fatty acids + Pyridoxine + Taurine + Vitamin A + Vitamin E + Zeaxanthin + Zinc picolinate

category.category: Agents for Treatment of Hemorrhoids and Anal Fissures for Topical Use
Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

atc-code.level: Other agents for treatment of hemorrhoids and anal fissures for topical use
AGENTS FOR TREATMENT OF HEMORRHOIDS AND ANAL FISSURES FOR TOPICAL USE

drug-interaction.name: Ursodeoxycholic acid
drug-interaction.description: Zinc picolinate can cause a decrease in the absorption of Ursodeoxycholic acid resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.
